How to Install lxsession-edit on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • lxsession-edit

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install lxsession-edit on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing lxsession-edit on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall lxsession-edit in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install lxsession-edit, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install lxsession-edit Using apt

To install lxsession-edit in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install lxsession-edit using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install lxsession-edit

The installation of lxsession-edit might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install lxsession-edit Using apt-get

To install lxsession-edit using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install lxsession-edit.

sudo apt-get -y install lxsession-edit

Install lxsession-edit Using Synaptic

To install lxsession-edit using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install lxsession-edit on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for lxsession-edit. This will display the lxsession-edit package in the package window, now to install lxsession-edit, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the lxsession-edit package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of lxsession-edit.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install lxsession-edit Using aptitude

To install lxsession-edit on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of lxsession-edit.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install lxsession-edit using the command aptitude install lxsession-edit.

sudo aptitude -y install lxsession-edit

How to Upgrade lxsession-edit on debian

If you want to upgrade the lxsession-edit package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade lxsession-edit using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade lxsession-edit to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade lxsession-edit.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade lxsession-edit sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade lxsession-edit

Upgrade lxsession-edit using Aptitude

To upgrade lxsession-edit using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade lxsession-edit.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade lxsession-edit

Upgrade lxsession-edit using Synaptic

To upgrade lxsession-edit using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for lxsession-edit, now right-click lxsession-edit, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade lxsession-edit just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall lxsession-edit on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall lxsession-edit from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just lxsession-edit, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove lxsession-edit

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of lxsession-edit

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of lxsession-edit you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge lxsession-edit

Remove lxsession-edit using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall lxsession-edit using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for lxsession-edit, right-click the lxsession-edit package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall lxsession-edit click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install lxsession-edit on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade lxsession-edit using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of lxsession-edit then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
